1. Introduction
contents.ja: 1.はじめに

contents.text: This document presents a few use cases of web applications that are executed in a browser and use real-time communication capabilities. In most of the use cases, all end-user clients are web applications, but there are some use cases where at least one of the end-user clients is of another type (e.g., a mobile phone or a SIP User Agent (UA)).

contents.text: Based on the use cases, the document derives requirements related to browser functionality. These requirements are named "Fn", where n is an integer, and are listed in conjunction with the use cases. A summary is provided in Section 3.2.

contents.text: 2. Use Cases
contents.ja: 2.ユースケース

contents.text: 2.1. Introduction
contents.ja: 2.1。前書き

contents.text: This section describes web-based real-time communication use cases, from which requirements are derived.
contents.ja: このセクションでは、要件が由来するウェブベースのリアルタイム通信の使用例を、説明しています。

contents.text: The following considerations are applicable to all use cases:
contents.ja: 次の考慮事項がすべてのユースケースに適用されます。

contents.text: o Clients can be on IPv4-only
contents.ja: OクライアントはIPv4のみにすることができ

contents.text: o Clients can be on IPv6-only
contents.ja: OクライアントはIPv6のみにすることができ

contents.text: o Clients can be on dual-stack o Clients can be connected to networks with different throughput capabilities
contents.ja: クライアントは、異なるスループット能力を持つネットワークに接続することができます〇〇クライアントは、デュアルスタックにすることができ

contents.text: o Clients can be on variable-media-quality networks (wireless)
contents.ja: Oクライアントは、可変メディア品質のネットワーク（無線）にすることができ

contents.text: o Clients can be on congested networks
contents.ja: Oクライアントは、混雑したネットワーク上に存在することができます

contents.text: o Clients can be on firewalled networks with no UDP allowed
contents.ja: 何UDPが許可されていないとOクライアントは、ファイアウォールのネットワーク上に存在することができます

contents.text: o Clients can be on networks with a NAT or IPv4-IPv6 translation devices using any type of Mapping and Filtering behaviors (as described in RFC 4787).
contents.ja: OクライアントがNATまたはマッピングおよびフィルタリング動作の任意のタイプを使用したIPv4-IPv6変換装置（RFC 4787に記載されているように）を用いてネットワーク上にあってもよいです。

contents.text: 2.2. Common Requirements
contents.ja: 2.2。共通要件

contents.text: The requirements retrieved from the Simple Video Communication Service use case (Section 2.3.1) by default apply to all other use cases and are considered common. For each use case, only the additional requirements are listed.
contents.ja: デフォルトでは、シンプルな映像コミュニケーションサービスのユースケース（2.3.1）から取得要件は、他のすべてのユースケースに適用され、一般的な考えられています。各ユースケースの場合、唯一の追加要件が記載されています。

contents.text: 2.3. Browser-to-Browser Use Cases
contents.ja: 2.3。ブラウザ・ツー・ブラウザのユースケース

contents.text: 2.3.1. Simple Video Communication Service
contents.ja: 2.3.1。シンプルなビデオコミュニケーションサービス

contents.text: 2.3.1.1. Description

Two or more users have loaded a video communication web application into their browsers, provided by the same service provider, and logged into the service it provides. The web service publishes information about user login status by pushing updates to the web application in the browsers. When one online user selects a peer online user, a 1:1 audiovisual communication session between the browsers of the two peers is initiated. The invited user might accept or reject the session.
contents.ja: 二人以上のユーザーが同じサービスプロバイダが提供する、ブラウザへのビデオ通信のWebアプリケーションを、ロードされ、それが提供するサービスにログインしています。 Webサービスは、ブラウザでのWebアプリケーションへの更新を押すことによって、ユーザのログイン状態に関する情報を公開しています。 1人のオンラインユーザーは、ピアオンラインユーザーを選択すると、1：2つのピアのブラウザ間1視聴覚通信セッションが開始されます。招待されたユーザーは、セッションを受け入れるか拒否することがあります。

contents.text: During session establishment, a self view is displayed, and once the session has been established the video sent from the remote peer is displayed in addition to the self view. During the session, each user can:
contents.ja: セッション確立時に、自己ビューが表示され、セッションが確立された後、リモートピアから送信された映像は、自己ビューに加えて表示されます。セッション中に、各ユーザーのことができます。

contents.text: o select to remove and reinsert the self-view as often as desired,
contents.ja: Oとして、多くの場合、必要に応じて、自己のビューを削除し、再挿入することを選択し、

contents.text: o change the sizes of his/her two video displays during the session, and
contents.ja: Oセッションの間に彼/彼女の2つのビデオ・ディスプレイのサイズを変更し、

contents.text: o pause the sending of media (audio, video, or both) and mute incoming media.
contents.ja: Oメディア（オーディオ、ビデオ、またはその両方）とミュート着信メディアの送信を一時停止します。

contents.text: It is essential that media and data be encrypted, authenticated, and integrity protected on a per-IP-packet basis and that media and data packets failing the integrity check not be delivered to the application.
contents.ja: メディアやデータは、暗号化、認証、および整合性ごとのIPパケット基礎およびアプリケーションに配信されない整合性チェックに失敗しているメディアやデータパケットに保護することが不可欠です。

contents.text: The application gives the users the opportunity to stop it from exposing the host IP address to the application of the other user.
contents.ja: アプリケーションは、ユーザーが他のユーザーのアプリケーションにホストのIPアドレスを暴露するからそれを停止する機会を与えてくれます。

contents.text: Any session participant can end the session at any time.
contents.ja: 任意のセッション参加者は、いつでもセッションを終了することができます。

contents.text: The two users may be using communication devices with different operating systems and browsers from different vendors.
contents.ja: 2人のユーザが異なるベンダーからの異なるオペレーティングシステムとブラウザとの通信デバイスを使用してもよいです。

contents.text: The web service monitors the quality of the service (focus on quality of audio and video) that the end users experience.
contents.ja: Webサービスは、エンドユーザーの経験ということ（オーディオおよびビデオの品質に焦点を当てる）サービスの品質を監視します。

contents.text: 2.3.1.2. Common Requirements

----------------------------------------------------------------
REQ-ID          DESCRIPTION
----------------------------------------------------------------
F1              The browser must be able to use microphones and
                cameras as input devices to generate streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F2              The browser must be able to send streams and
                data to a peer in the presence of NATs.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F3              Transmitted streams and data must be rate
                controlled (meaning that the browser must, regardless
                of application behavior, reduce send rate when
                there is congestion).
----------------------------------------------------------------
F4              The browser must be able to receive, process, and
                render streams and data ("render" does not
                apply for data) from peers.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F5              The browser should be able to render good quality
                audio and video even in the presence of
                reasonable levels of jitter and packet losses.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F6              The browser must detect when a stream from a
                peer is not received anymore.

----------------------------------------------------------------
F7              When there are both incoming and outgoing audio
                streams, echo cancellation must be made
                available to avoid disturbing echo during
                conversation.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F8              The browser must support synchronization of
                audio and video.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F9              The browser should use encoding of streams
                suitable for the current rendering (e.g.,
                video display size) and should change parameters
                if the rendering changes during the session.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F10             The browser must support a baseline audio and
                video codec.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F11             It must be possible to protect streams and data
                from wiretapping [RFC2804] [RFC7258].
----------------------------------------------------------------
F12             The browser must enable verification, given
                the right circumstances and by use of other
                trusted communication, that streams and
                data received have not been manipulated by
                any party.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F13             The browser must encrypt, authenticate, and
                integrity protect media and data on a
                per-IP-packet basis, and it must drop incoming media
                and data packets that fail the per-IP-packet
                integrity check.  In addition, the browser
                must support a mechanism for cryptographically
                binding media and data security keys to the
                user identity (see R-ID-BINDING in [RFC5479]).
----------------------------------------------------------------
F14             The browser must make it possible to set up a
                call between two parties without one party
                learning the other party's host IP address.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F15             The browser must be able to collect statistics,

contents.text: 2.3.2. Simple Video Communication Service: NAT/Firewall That Blocks UDP
contents.ja: 2.3.2。シンプルなビデオコミュニケーションサービス：NAT /ファイアウォールをブロックするUDP

contents.text: 2.3.2.1. Description
This use case is almost identical to the Simple Video Communication Service use case (Section 2.3.1). The difference is that one of the users is behind a NAT/firewall that blocks UDP traffic.
contents.ja: このユースケースは、シンプルなビデオコミュニケーションサービスのユースケース（2.3.1項）とほぼ同じです。違いは、ユーザの一人は、そのブロックUDPトラフィックのNAT /ファイアウォールの背後にあるということです。

contents.text: 2.3.2.2. Additional Requirements
2.3.3. Simple Video Communication Service: Firewall That Only Allows Traffic via an HTTP Proxy
contents.ja: 2.3.3。シンプルなビデオコミュニケーションサービス：のみHTTPプロキシを経由してトラフィックを許可するファイアウォール

contents.text: 2.3.3.1. Description

This use case is almost identical to the Simple Video Communication Service use case (Section 2.3.1). The difference is that one of the users is behind a firewall that only allows traffic via an HTTP Proxy.
contents.ja: このユースケースは、シンプルなビデオコミュニケーションサービスのユースケース（2.3.1項）とほぼ同じです。違いは、ユーザの一人が唯一のHTTPプロキシを経由してトラフィックを許可するファイアウォールの背後にあるということです。

2.3.4. Simple Video Communication Service: Global Service Provider
contents.ja: 2.3.4。シンプルなビデオコミュニケーションサービス：グローバル・サービス・プロバイダー

contents.text: 2.3.4.1. Description

This use case is almost identical to the Simple Video Communication Service use case (Section 2.3.1). What is added is that the service provider is operating over large geographical areas (or even globally).
contents.ja: このユースケースは、シンプルなビデオコミュニケーションサービスのユースケース（2.3.1項）とほぼ同じです。どのような追加されたことは、サービスプロバイダが、大きな地理的領域上で動作する（あるいはグローバル）されていることです。

contents.text: Assuming that the Interactive Connectivity Establishment (ICE) mechanism [RFC5245] will be used, this means that the service provider would like to be able to provide several Session Traversal Utilities for NAT (STUN) and Traversal Using Relay NAT (TURN) servers (via the app) to the browser; selection of which one(s) to use is part of the ICE processing. Other reasons for wanting to provide several STUN and TURN servers include support for IPv4 and IPv6, load balancing, and redundancy.
contents.ja: インタラクティブ接続確立（ICE）のメカニズム[RFC5245]が使用されると仮定すると、これは、サービスプロバイダは、経由（リレーNAT（TURN）サーバを使用してNAT（STUN）とトラバーサルのために、いくつかのセッショントラバーサルユーティリティを提供できるようにしたいということを意味しますブラウザへのアプリ）。使用する1つ（または複数）の選択は、ICE処理の一部です。いくつかのSTUNやTURNサーバを提供したい他の理由は、IPv4とIPv6のサポート、負荷分散、および冗長性が含まれます。

contents.text: Note that ICE support being mandatory does not preclude a WebRTC endpoint from supporting more traversal mechanisms than ICE using STUN and TURN.
contents.ja: そのICEのサポートはSTUNやTURNを使用してICEよりも多くのトラバースメカニズムをサポートしているからのWebRTCエンドポイントを妨げるものではない必須であることに注意してください。

contents.text: 2.3.4.2. Additional Requirements
2.3.5. Simple Video Communication Service: Enterprise Aspects
contents.ja: 2.3.5。シンプルなビデオコミュニケーションサービス：エンタープライズ側面

contents.text: 2.3.5.1. Description
This use case is similar to the Simple Video Communication Service use case (Section 2.3.1).
contents.ja: このユースケースは、シンプルなビデオコミュニケーションサービスのユースケース（2.3.1項）と同様です。

contents.text: What is added is aspects when using the service in enterprises. ICE is assumed in the further description of this use case.
contents.ja: 企業でのサービスを使用するときには何加算さは側面です。 ICEは、この使用例の更なる説明において想定されます。

contents.text: An enterprise that uses a WebRTC-based web application for communication desires to audit all WebRTC-based application sessions used from inside the company towards any external peer. To be able to do this, they deploy a TURN server that straddles the boundary between the internal and the external network.
contents.ja: 通信のためのWebRTCベースのWebアプリケーションを使用する企業は、外部ピアに向かって企業内から使用されているすべてのWebRTCベースのアプリケーションセッションを監査することを望みます。これを行うことができるために、彼らは内部と外部ネットワークとの間の境界をまたぐTURNサーバーを展開します。

contents.text: The firewall will block all attempts to use STUN with an external destination unless they go to the enterprise auditing TURN server. In cases where employees are using WebRTC applications provided by an external service provider, they still want the traffic to stay inside their internal network and in addition not load the straddling TURN server; thus, they deploy a STUN server allowing the WebRTC client to determine its server reflexive address on the internal side. Thus, enabling cases where peers are both on the internal side to connect without the traffic leaving the internal network. It must be possible to configure the browsers used in the enterprise with network specific STUN and TURN servers. This should be possible to achieve by autoconfiguration methods. The WebRTC functionality will need to utilize both network specific STUN and TURN resources and STUN and TURN servers provisioned by the web application.

contents.text: All participants are authenticated by the central server and authorized to connect to the central server. The participants are identified to each other by the central server, and the participants do not have access to each others' credentials such as email addresses or login IDs.
contents.ja: すべての参加者は、中央サーバによって認証され、中央サーバーへの接続が許可されています。参加者は、中央サーバによって相互に識別され、参加者は、電子メールアドレスやログインIDなど互いの資格情報にアクセスすることはできません。

contents.text: Note: This use case adds requirements on support for fast stream switches (F16). There exist several solutions that enable the server to forward one high-resolution and several low-resolution video streams: a) each browser could send a high-resolution, but scalable stream, and the server could send just the base layer for the low-resolution streams, b) each browser could in a simulcast fashion send one high-resolution and one low-resolution stream, and the server just selects, or c) each browser sends just a high-resolution stream, the server transcodes into low-resolution streams as required.
contents.ja: 注：このユースケースは、高速ストリームスイッチ（F16）のサポートに関する要件を追加します。そこ1つの高解像度と、複数の低解像度のビデオストリーム転送するためにサーバーを有効にするいくつかのソリューションが存在します。a）各ブラウザは、高解像度を送ることができますが、スケーラブルなストリームは、サーバが低のためだけのベース層を送ることができます解像度ストリームは、B）各ブラウザがサイマルキャスト方式で1つの高解像度と一つの低解像度ストリーム、及びだけを選択、または、c）各ブラウザがちょうど高解像度のストリームを送信するサーバを送ることができ、サーバは、低解像度にトランスコード必要に応じてストリーム。

3. Requirements Summary
contents.ja: 3.要件の概要

contents.text: 3.1. General
contents.ja: 3.1。一般的な

contents.text: This section contains the requirements on the browser derived from the use cases in Section 2.
contents.ja: このセクションでは、第2節では、ユースケースから派生ブラウザ上の要件が含まれています。

contents.text: Note: It is assumed that the user applications are executed on a browser. Whether the capabilities to implement specific browser requirements are implemented by the browser application, or are provided to the browser application by the underlying operating system, is outside the scope of this document.
contents.ja: 注意：ユーザアプリケーションがブラウザ上で実行されているものとします。特定のブラウザ要件を実現する能力は、ブラウザアプリケーションによって実装され、または基礎となるオペレーティング・システムによって、ブラウザ・アプリケーションに提供されているかどうか、この文書の範囲外です。

contents.text: 3.2. Browser Requirements
contents.ja: 3.2。ブラウザ要件

contents.text:
----------------------------------------------------------------
Common, basic requirements
----------------------------------------------------------------
REQ-ID          DESCRIPTION
----------------------------------------------------------------
F1              The browser must be able to use microphones and
                cameras as input devices to generate streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F2              The browser must be able to send streams and
                data to a peer in the presence of NATs.

----------------------------------------------------------------
F3              Transmitted streams and data must be rate
                controlled (meaning that the browser must, regardless
                of application behavior, reduce send rate when
                there is congestion).
----------------------------------------------------------------
F4              The browser must be able to receive, process, and
                render streams and data ("render" does not
                apply for data) from peers.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F5              The browser should be able to render good quality
                audio and video even in the presence of
                reasonable levels of jitter and packet losses.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F6              The browser must detect when a stream from a
                peer is not received anymore.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F7              When there are both incoming and outgoing audio
                streams, echo cancellation must be made
                available to avoid disturbing echo during
                conversation.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F8              The browser must support synchronization of
                audio and video.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F9              The browser should use encoding of streams
                suitable for the current rendering (e.g.,
                video display size) and should change parameters
                if the rendering changes during the session
----------------------------------------------------------------
F10             The browser must support a baseline audio and
                video codec.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F11             It must be possible to protect streams and data
                from wiretapping [RFC2804] [RFC7258].
----------------------------------------------------------------
F12             The browser must enable verification, given
                the right circumstances and by use of other
                trusted communication, that streams and
                data received have not been manipulated by
                any party.

----------------------------------------------------------------
F13             The browser must encrypt, authenticate, and
                integrity protect media and data on a
                per-IP-packet basis, and it must drop incoming media
                and data packets that fail the per-IP-packet
                integrity check.  In addition, the browser
                must support a mechanism for cryptographically
                binding media and data security keys to the
                user identity (see R-ID-BINDING in [RFC5479]).
----------------------------------------------------------------
F14             The browser must make it possible to set up a
                call between two parties without one party
                learning the other party's host IP address.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F15             The browser must be able to collect statistics,
                related to the transport of audio and video
                between peers, needed to estimate quality of
                experience.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Requirements related to network and topology
----------------------------------------------------------------
REQ-ID          DESCRIPTION
----------------------------------------------------------------
F16             The browser must support insertion of reference frames
                in outgoing media streams when requested by a peer.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F17             The communication session must survive across a
                change of the network interface used by the
                session.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F18             The browser must be able to send streams and
                data to a peer in the presence of NATs and
                firewalls that block UDP traffic.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F19             The browser must be able to use several STUN
                and TURN servers.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F20             The browser must support the use of STUN and TURN
                servers that are supplied by entities other than
                the web application (i.e., the network provider).
----------------------------------------------------------------
F21             The browser must be able to send streams and
                data to a peer in the presence of firewalls that only
                allow traffic via an HTTP Proxy, when firewall policy
                allows WebRTC traffic.

----------------------------------------------------------------
F22             The browser should be able to take advantage
                of available capabilities (supplied by network
                nodes) to differentiate voice, video, and data
                appropriately.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Requirements related to multiple peers and streams
----------------------------------------------------------------
REQ-ID          DESCRIPTION
----------------------------------------------------------------
F23             The browser must be able to transmit streams and
                data to several peers concurrently.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F24             The browser must be able to receive streams and
                data from multiple peers concurrently.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F25             The browser must be able to render several
                concurrent audio and video streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F26             The browser must be able to mix several
                audio streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Requirements related to audio processing
----------------------------------------------------------------
REQ-ID          DESCRIPTION
----------------------------------------------------------------
F27             The browser must be able to apply spatialization
                effects when playing audio streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F28             The browser must be able to measure the
                voice activity level in audio streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F29             The browser must be able to change the
                voice activity level in audio streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F30             The browser must be able to process and mix
                sound objects (media that is retrieved from
                another source than the established media
                stream(s) with the peer(s) with audio streams).
----------------------------------------------------------------
Requirements related to legacy interop
----------------------------------------------------------------
REQ-ID          DESCRIPTION
----------------------------------------------------------------
F31             The browser must support an audio media format
                (codec) that is commonly supported by existing
                telephony services.

----------------------------------------------------------------
F32             There should be a way to navigate
                a dual-tone multi-frequency signaling (DTMF)
                based Interactive Voice Response (IVR) system.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F33             The browser must be able to initiate and
                accept a media session where the data needed
                for establishment can be carried in SIP.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Other requirements
----------------------------------------------------------------
REQ-ID          DESCRIPTION
----------------------------------------------------------------
F34             The browser must be able to send short
                latency unreliable datagram traffic to a
                peer browser [RFC5405].
----------------------------------------------------------------
F35             The browser must be able to send reliable
                data traffic to a peer browser.
----------------------------------------------------------------
F36             The browser must be able to generate streams
                using the entire user display, a specific area
                of the user display or the information being
                displayed by a specific application.
----------------------------------------------------------------
4. Security Considerations
contents.ja: 4.セキュリティについての考慮事項

contents.text: 4.1. Introduction
contents.ja: 4.1。前書き

contents.text: A malicious web application might use the browser to perform Denial-of-Service (DoS) attacks on NAT infrastructure, or on peer devices. For example, a malicious web application might leak TURN credentials to unauthorized parties, allowing them to consume the TURN server's bandwidth. To address this risk, web applications should be prepared to revoke TURN credentials and issue new ones. Also, a malicious web application might silently establish outgoing, and accept incoming, streams on an already established connection.
contents.ja: 悪質なWebアプリケーションは、NATのインフラ上、またはピアデバイス上のサービス拒否（DoS）攻撃を実行するためにブラウザを使用する場合があります。たとえば、悪意のあるWebアプリケーションは、彼らがTURNサーバーの帯域幅を消費することができ、権限のない者にTURN資格情報をリークする可能性があります。このリスクに対処するために、Webアプリケーションは、TURN資格を取り消し、新しいものを発行するために準備する必要があります。また、静かに出て行く確立し、着信受け入れる可能性がある悪質なWebアプリケーションは、すでに確立された接続上でストリーム。

contents.text: Based on the identified security risks, this section will describe security considerations for the browser and web application.
contents.ja: 識別されたセキュリティ上のリスクに基づいて、このセクションでは、ブラウザとWebアプリケーションのセキュリティ上の考慮事項について説明します。

contents.text: 4.2. Browser Considerations
contents.ja: 4.2。ブラウザの考慮事項

contents.text: The browser is expected to provide mechanisms for getting user consent to use device resources such as camera and microphone.
contents.ja: ブラウザは、カメラやマイクなどのデバイスリソースを使用するようにユーザーの同意を取得するためのメカニズムを提供することが期待されます。

contents.text: The browser is expected to provide mechanisms for informing the user that device resources such as camera and microphone are in use ("hot").
contents.ja: ブラウザは、カメラやマイクなどのデバイスリソースが使用中（「ホット」）であることをユーザに通知するためのメカニズムを提供することが期待されます。

contents.text: The browser must provide mechanisms for users to revise and even completely revoke consent to use device resources such as camera and microphone.
contents.ja: ブラウザは、ユーザーが修正しても、完全にカメラやマイクなどのデバイスリソースを使用するために同意を取り消すためのメカニズムを提供しなければなりません。

contents.text: The browser is expected to provide mechanisms for getting user consent to use the screen (or a certain part of it) or what a certain application displays on the screen as source for streams.
contents.ja: ブラウザは、ストリームのソースとして画面上にスクリーン（またはその特定の部分）又はどんな特定のアプリケーションのディスプレイを使用するユーザーの同意を得るためのメカニズムを提供することが期待されます。

contents.text: The browser is expected to provide mechanisms for informing the user that the screen, part thereof, or an application is serving as a stream source ("hot").
contents.ja: ブラウザは、スクリーンは、その一部、またはアプリケーションは、ストリームソース（「ホット」）として機能しているユーザに知らせるためのメカニズムを提供することが期待されます。

contents.text: The browser must provide mechanisms for users to revise and even completely revoke consent to use the screen, part thereof, or an application as a stream source.
contents.ja: ブラウザは、ユーザーが修正しても完全にスクリーンを使用する同意を取り消し、部分、またはそれらのストリームソースとして応用するためのメカニズムを提供しなければなりません。

contents.text: The browser is expected to provide mechanisms in order to assure that streams are the ones the recipient intended to receive.
contents.ja: ブラウザは、ストリームは、受信者が受信することを意図したものであることを保証するためにメカニズムを提供することが期待されます。

contents.text: The browser is expected to provide mechanisms that allow the users to verify that the streams received have not be manipulated (F12).
contents.ja: ブラウザは、ユーザーが受信したストリームは（F12）が操作されていないことを確認することを可能にするメカニズムを提供することが期待されます。

contents.text: The browser needs to ensure that media is not sent, and that received media is not rendered, until the associated stream establishment and handshake procedures with the remote peer have been successfully finished.
contents.ja: ブラウザは、そのメディアが送信されていないことを確認する必要があり、リモートピアに関連付けられたストリームの確立とハンドシェイク手順が正常に終了されるまで、その受信されたメディアは、レンダリングされません。

contents.text: The browser needs to ensure that the stream negotiation procedures are not seen as DoS by other entities.
contents.ja: ブラウザは、ストリームのネゴシエーション手順は他のエンティティによってDoS攻撃と見られていないことを確認する必要があります。

contents.text: 4.3. Web Application Considerations
contents.ja: 4.3。 Webアプリケーションの考慮事項

contents.text: The web application is expected to ensure user consent in sending and receiving media streams.
contents.ja: Webアプリケーションは、メディアストリームを送受信するにはユーザーの同意を確保することが期待されます。

contents.ja: 付録A. APIの要件

                application to ask the browser for permission

----------------------------------------------------------------

                application to control how streams generated

----------------------------------------------------------------
A3              The web API must provide means for the web
                application to control the local rendering of

----------------------------------------------------------------

                application to initiate the sending of a

Note: The level of control depends on whether
                the codec negotiation is handled by the browser

                application to modify the media format for
                streams sent to a peer after a media stream
                has been established.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A7              The web API must provide means for
                informing the web application of whether or not
                the establishment of a stream with a peer was
                successful.

----------------------------------------------------------------
A8              The web API must provide means for the web
                application to mute/unmute a stream or stream
                component(s). When a stream is sent to a peer,
                mute status must be preserved in the stream
                received by the peer.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A9              The web API must provide means for the web
                application to cease the sending of a stream
                to a peer.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A10             The web API must provide means for the web
                application to cease the processing and rendering
                of a stream received from a peer.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A11             The web API must provide means for
                informing the web application when a
                stream from a peer is no longer received.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A12             The web API must provide means for
                informing the web application when high
                loss rates occur.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A13             The web API must provide means for the web
                application to apply spatialization effects to
                audio streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A14             The web API must provide means for the web
                application to detect the level in audio
                streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A15             The web API must provide means for the web
                application to adjust the level in audio
                streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A16             The web API must provide means for the web
                application to mix audio streams.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A17             The web API must provide a way to identify
                streams such that an application is able to
                match streams on a sending peer with the same
                stream on all receiving peers.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A18             The web API must provide a mechanism for sending
                and receiving isolated discrete chunks of data.

----------------------------------------------------------------
A19             The web API must provide means for the web
                application to indicate the type of audio signal
                (speech, audio) for audio stream(s) / stream
                component(s).
----------------------------------------------------------------

                responder web application to indicate the types
                of media it is willing to accept incoming
                streams for when setting up a connection (audio,

                application to ask the browser for permission
                to use the screen, a certain area on the screen,
                or what a certain application displays on the

                application to specify several STUN and/or
                TURN servers to use.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A23             The web API must provide means for the
                application to specify the priority to
                apply for outgoing streams and data.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A24             The web API must provide a mechanism for sending
                and receiving files.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A25             It must be possible for the application to
                instruct the browser to refrain from exposing
                the host IP address to the application.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A26             The web API must provide means for the
                application to obtain the statistics (related
                to transport, and collected by the browser)
